snippet: Three people were formally charged in connection with an unsuccessful plot to smuggle Saadi el-Qaddafi into Mexico, the attorney general’s office said Wednesday.
abstract: Canadian woman, a Danish man and two Mexicans have been formally charged in connection with an unsuccessful plot to smuggle Saadi el-Qaddafi, one of the sons of former Libyan leader Col Muammar el-Qaddafi, into Mexico.
lead_paragraph: Three people were formally charged in connection with an unsuccessful plot to smuggle Saadi el-Qaddafi into Mexico, the attorney general’s office said Wednesday.

headline.main: Mexico: Charges in Plot to Aid a Qaddafi
headline.print_headline: Mexico: Charges in Plot to Aid a Qaddafi
